{{Infobox figure skater |name= Keegan Messing |image= 2010 JWC Keegan MESSING.jpg |caption= Messing in 2010 |fullname = Keegan Messing |country= [[United States]] |birth_date= {{birth date and age|1992|01|23}} |birth_place= [[Girdwood]] |hometown= |residence= |coach= [[Ralph Burghart]]
Anne Durham (1995-99) |choreographer= [[Rory Flack]] |skating club= Alaska Association of Figure Skaters|retired= |combined total= 197.03 |combined date= [[2010 World Junior Figure Skating Championships|2010 Junior Worlds]] |SP score= 72.58 |SP date= [[2011 World Junior Figure Skating Championships|2011 Junior Worlds]] |FS score= 128.13 |FS date= [[2010 World Junior Figure Skating Championships|2010 Junior Worlds]] }} '''Keegan Messing''' (born January 23, 1992 in [[Girdwood]], [[Alaska]]) is an [[United States|American]] [[figure skater]]. He was the silver medalist in the junior men's division at the [[United States Figure Skating Championships|2009 nationals]]. He placed 4th at the [[2010 World Junior Figure Skating Championships|2010 World Junior Championships]]. == Career == Messing started skating at age 3 after watching the 1994 Olympics. The biggest influence in his life has been [[Elvis Stojko]], of whom Messing said, "Watching him skate made me want to skate". Before competing in singles, he formerly skated pairs with Ellie Gottstein. Keegan won the silver medal at the [[2009 United States Figure Skating Championships|2009 U.S. Junior Championships]]. The following season, he made his senior national debut, finishing 9th. He finished 8th at the [[2011 United States Figure Skating Championships|2011 U.S. Nationals]]. He trains in Alaska. Messing won the [[2011 Coupe Internationale de Nice|2011 Coupe de Nice]] after placing first in the short program and fourth in the free. == Personal life == Messing graduated through the Interior Distance Education of Alaska in May 2010. His hobbies include playing the piano and yo-yoing and he enjoys anything active and outdoors such as skiing, mountain biking, water skiing, hiking, camping, snowshoeing, etc. His younger brother, Paxon, is a competitive snowboarder and has qualified for the USASA National Championships the last three years. Messing supports the Girdwood Forest Fair, a craft fair that raises money for nonprofit organizations and families in his community, Little Bears Playhouse, and Challenge Alaska (an alternative ski program). == Programs == {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !
